CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 1, 1972, pg. 1 reads: "Demand Fair Bidding - Those who work the hardest - enjoy the least, say black construction workers, seen picketing the downtown office of the Pittsburgh Housing Authority earlier this week. The workers believe black contractors deserve a fair bidding procedure on the rehabilitation contract to be awarded by the authority for Bedford Dwellings in Hill District.  Black contractors are seeking an injunction to stop the current bidding, slated to end July 6, with a July 3 hearing before Common Pleas Judge Marion K. Finkelhor. (Harris Photo)"
TitMainTitle: Construction workers, including Roy Mellix in front, demonstrating with placards reading "Fair bidding! Fair award! No game playing!" and "Housing Board Committee, how can we judge our community income?" in front of Pittsburgh Housing Authority, Ross Street, Downtown
